intro: Strobilanthes thwaitesii, commonly known as the "Tawarai" or "Flower of the Gods," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet, tropical environments, often near water bodies. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from red to purple, and are highly attractive to pollinators. Strobilanthes thwaitesii is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
